oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Meigs School, 1959
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Meigs School, located at 713 Ramsey Street, 15 September 1959. Named in honor of James L. Meigs, Nashville's second superintendent of public schools, Meigs school opened as a grammar school for African Americans in 1883 on Georgia Street. It remained an elementary and middle school until the 1958-1959 school year, when it became a high school. By the 1962-1963 school year, Meigs had a program that encompassed grades K-12. In 1970, Meigs became a junior high school, and it is currently known as Meigs Middle Magnet School today. Photographed by Jerry Hiland of the Nashville Housing Authority. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Housing Authority (Nashville, Tenn.); Meigs High School (Nashville, Tenn.);
